hotspots.label: Bright Orange Foot
hotspots.fact: This newt's bright orange belly is a warning to predators that it's poisonous! The vibrant color tells other animals to stay away. This is called aposematism, or warning coloration.

hotspots.label: Bumpy Skin Texture
hotspots.fact: Newts have bumpy, warty skin that helps them absorb moisture and oxygen directly through their skin. They can breathe partly through their skin, which is why they must stay moist!

hotspots.label: Newt Body Shape
hotspots.fact: Newts are small salamanders with long tails that help them swim and balance. They live part of their lives in water and part on land, making them amphibians!

hotspots.label: Moist Habitat (Mulch)
hotspots.fact: This newt is found in damp places like leaf litter and soil. Newts need moisture to survive because their skin can dry out easily, so they avoid hot, dry areas.
